intro: Matelea corynephora, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant is a perennial shrub with woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically trumpet-shaped and emit a sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths. Matelea corynephora thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
